Message.InnerHTML:
Updated 2018/09/18
Firmware 6.0.0 support
SDFiles v9
Hekate v4.1

Bundles.Name: SDFiles Defaults
Bundles.Description: Includes the default packages found in tomGER's SDFilesSwitch.

Bundles.Name: Minimal
Bundles.Description: Includes just enough to get Atmosphere CFW and homebrew running, with no extras.

Bundles.Name: Everything
Bundles.Description: Includes every package for your homebrew hoarding needs.

Packages.Name: SX OS
Packages.Description: Premium (paid) custom firmware with user friendly interface for loading cart backups, digital backups, homebrew and more.

Packages.Name: ReiNX
Packages.Description: A modular custom firmware for the Nintendo Switch. Includes sigpatches, homebrew via album, and more.

Packages.Name: Atmosphere
Packages.Description: Work in progress custom firmware with the goal of replacing each component of the Nintendo Switch system. Configured with Hekate, including sys-ftpd, espatches, homebrew loading and more.

PackageSections.Name: CFW Options
PackageSections.Footer: These modules are powered by tomGER's SDFilesSwitch

Packages.Name: Disable Gamecard Slot
Packages.Description: Disables Gamecard slot to prevent sideloaded firmwares from preventing the gamecard slot from working after downgrading lower than v4.0.0.

Packages.Name: Enable Signature Patches
Packages.Description: Allows launching of sideloaded NSP files.

Packages.Name: SwitchPresence
Packages.Description: Add automatic Discord rich presence support for Nintendo Switch titles (tell people what you are playing on Discord).

Packages.Name: Sys-FTPD
Packages.Description: Have an FTP server running in the background on your Switch for managing files on your SD card remotely.

Packages.Name: Sys-Netcheat
Packages.Description: Remote cheat engine for Switch using Netcat.

Packages.Name: XorPlay
Packages.Description: Play audio in the background on your Nintendo Switch.

Packages.Name: SDFilesSwitch Boot Logo
Packages.Description: Hekate bootlogo featuring Atmosphere Alpha and SDFilesSwitch.

Packages.Name: Must Have
Packages.Description: Required files for Atmosphere.

Packages.Name: Homebrew Menu
Packages.Description: Menu to launch all of your Switch NRO homebrew.

Packages.Name: AppStoreNX
Packages.Description: Switch app to access view and download homebrew from the SwitchBru Appstore.

Packages.Name: JK's Save Manager
Packages.Description: WIP save manager for Switch.

Packages.Name: Checkpoint
Packages.Description: A fast and simple homebrew save manager for 3DS and Switch written in C++.

Packages.Name: EdiZon
Packages.Description: A save file dumper, injector and on-console editor for Horizon, the OS of the Nintendo Switch. Developed by thomasnet-mc and WerWolv. Features a scripting framework for easy extension of the tool.

Packages.Name: NX Shell
Packages.Description: Work in progress file manager for the Nintendo Switch. Port of 3DShell.

Packages.Name: FTPD
Packages.Description: FTP server to allow you to access your Switch's files remotely.

Packages.Name: Tinfoil
Packages.Description: A homebrew application for the Nintendo Switch used to manage and install titles.

Packages.Name: ZeroTwoXCI
Packages.Description: A homebrew to install XCI files to NAND/SD as if they were NSP files.

Packages.Name: Gag Order
Packages.Description: A homebrew application which patches the "Supernag" on the Nintendo Switch.

Packages.Name: Mystery of Solarus DX
Packages.Description: A Zelda fan-game in the style of A Link to the Past ported to the Switch. Features a fully fleshed out experience with hours of gameplay.

Packages.Name: Prince of Persia
Packages.Description: Prince of Persia port using SDL2.

Packages.Name: Postal NX
Packages.Description: Postal port for the Nintendo Switch
2048 port for the Nintendo Switch.

Packages.Name: Pickr
Packages.Description: Pickr port for the Nintendo Switch.

Packages.Name: Pixel Painter
Packages.Description: A simple drawing game using LibNX.

Packages.Name: SpaceGameNX
Packages.Description: Simple graphical space shooter ported from the WiiU.

Packages.Name: RetroNX
Packages.Description: Bundle containing many RetroArch cores compiled for LibNX. You can select each core individually after selection.

Packages.Name: khedGB
Packages.Description: Experimental Gameboy Color emulator for the Switch.

Packages.Name: VBA Next
Packages.Description: Gameboy Advanced emulator for the Switch based on libretro and 3DSGBA.

Packages.Name: pSNES
Packages.Description: SNES emulator with a simple, userfriendly interface using the SNES9X core.

Packages.Name: pFBA
Packages.Description: An emulator for multiple arcade systems including Neo-Geo, Capcom, Konami and Cave games. Also supports some consoles such as megadrive, master system and more.

Packages.Name: ScummVM
Packages.Description: An emulator for various classic point-and-click adventure games.

Packages.Name: FCEUmm
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for the NES.

Packages.Name: SNES9X2010
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for the SNES. Based on SNES9X 1.52 from 2010, trading accuracy for better performance.

Packages.Name: SNES9X
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for the SNES. Higher accuracy than the 2010 variant, sacrificing performance.

Packages.Name: BeetleVB
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for the Virtual Boy.

Packages.Name: PCSX ReArmed
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for the PlayStation.

Packages.Name: Genesis GX Plus
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for the Genesis, Megadrive and Master System.

Packages.Name: PicoDrive
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for the Master System, SegaCD, Genesis, PICO and 32X.

Packages.Name: VirtualJaguar
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for the Atari Jaguar.

Packages.Name: Stella
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for the Atari 2600.

Packages.Name: ProSystem
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for the Atari 7800.

Packages.Name: 4DO
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for the 3DO

Packages.Name: O2em

Packages.Name: VECX
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for the Vectrex.

Packages.Description: Retroarch core for the Gameboy Advance.

Packages.Description: Retroarch core for the Gameboy Advance.

Packages.Name: MAME2003 Plus

Packages.Name: Final Burn Alpha
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for emulating thousands of arcade machine titles.

Packages.Name: Beetle PCE Fast
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for PC Engine.

Packages.Name: Beetle SuperGraFX

Packages.Name: DOSBox
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for DOS titles.

Packages.Name: fMSX
Packages.Description: Retroarch core for MSX titles.

Packages.Name: Hekate
Packages.Description: An alternative bootloader for the Nintendo  Switch, with firmware patching, recovery tools, and many more features.

Packages.Name: ReiNX Loader
Packages.Description: Fusee payload to load ReiNX.

Packages.Name: SX OS Loader
Packages.Description: Fusee payload for loading SX OS.

Packages.Name: biskeydump
Packages.Description: Fusee payload to dump BIS keys for eMMC content decryption.

Packages.Name: GPT Restore
Packages.Description: Restores the original Nintendo Switch GPT to your eMMC if you somehow messed it up.

Packages.Name: briccmii
Packages.Description: Corrupts (or fixes) the first byte of every BCT's pubkey in BOOT0 so your Nintendo Switch always enters RCM mode (or boots normally).

Packages.Name: TegraRCMSmash
Packages.Description: A reimplementation of fusee-launcher in C++ for Windows platforms. Lets you launch fusee/shofEL2 payloads to a USB connected Switch in RCM mode.

Packages.Name: 4NXCI
Packages.Description: A tool for converting XCI (NX Card Image) files to NSP (Nintendo Submission Package).

Packages.Name: LaunchPadNX
Packages.Description: LaunchpadNX lets you select what you want in your CFW, and it builds, compiles, and packages it all up in a drag-and-drop package for your SD Card! For Windows PCs.

Packages.Name: ChoiDujour
Packages.Description: Converts Nintendo Switch firmware update packages to installable images/files that can be transferred to the device itself

Packages.Name: hactool
Packages.Description: A tool to view information about, decrypt, and extract common file formats for the Nintendo Switch, especially Nintendo Content Archives.

Packages.Name: NCABuilder
Packages.Description: The first unofficial NCA builder for Switch titles. Heavily WIP and is currently unusable.

Packages.Name: Switch Backup Manager
Packages.Description: Complete Switch backup management tool for both XCI and NSP backups.

Packages.Name: Rekado
Packages.Description: Fusee payload and Lakka launcher for Android. Works without root.

Packages.Name: Luma3DS
Packages.Description: Noob-proof custom firmware, featuring signature patches, region lock bypass, a custom in-game menu and more.

PackageSections.Name: Payloads
PackageSections.Footer: Payloads are placed into /sd/luma/payloads for luma chainloading when applicable

Packages.Name: GodeMode9
Packages.Description: Full access NAND and SD manager with scripting support.

Packages.Name: OpenFirmInstaller
Packages.Description: Tool to install boot9strap FIRMs to NAND (currently only boot9strap and fastboot3ds).

Packages.Name: FastBoot3DS
Packages.Description: Custom bootloader for the 3DS with chainloading, NAND backup and restoring, OTP dumping and more. Requires OpenFirmInstaller to install.

PackageSections.Name: Homebrew
PackageSections.Footer:
Homebrew includes both CIA and 3DSX builds where available, and are only split if their file sizes are large.
CIA files are placed into /sd/cias

Packages.Name: Homebrew Menu
Packages.Description: A simple, but beautiful, menu that lists 3DSX homebrew applications. Compatible with ninjhax, *hax and Rosalina.

Packages.Name: BootNTR Selector
Packages.Description: Application to load real-time game plugins. Allows things like in-game inventory and stat editing, game patches, and more.

Packages.Name: BootNTR Selector (MODE3)
Packages.Description: Application to load real-time game plugins. Allows things like in-game inventory and stat editing, game patches, and more. Mode3 allows support for extended memory titles on Old 3DS (thus not necessary for N3DS).

Packages.Name: Sharkive
Packages.Description: GateShark cheatcode manager for Luma3DS v9.1+.

Packages.Name: FBI
Packages.Description: Open-source file browser and install for the 3DS. Browse SD card and internal NAND and install CIA files.

Packages.Name: FTPDB
Packages.Description: FTP server for 3DS to allow remote management of the SD card.

Packages.Name: MultiUpdater
Packages.Description: Updater for FIRM payloads, CIA applications and other files on the SD card.

Packages.Name: Checkpoint
Packages.Description: Graphical save manager for 3DS with backup and restore functionality.

Packages.Name: JKSM
Packages.Description: Simplel save manager for 3DS with backup and restore functionality.

Packages.Name: PKSM
Packages.Description: On-console save editor for GenIV-GenVII Pokemon games. Features in depth stat editing for your Pokemon and an offline Pokemon Bank clone.

Packages.Name: 3DSident
Packages.Description: 3DSident is an application for displaying lots of information about your 3DS, including serial number, screen types, firmware versions, and more.

Packages.Name: 3DSident GUI
Packages.Description: 3DSident with a nicer GUI.

Packages.Name: Anemone3DS
Packages.Description: Theme and splashscreen manager for 3DS with QR code scanning.

Packages.Name: Breakout
Packages.Description: Breakout clone for the 3DS.

Packages.Name: Mastermind
Packages.Description: Mastermind clone for the 3DS with CPU and local (same system) multiplayer.

Packages.Name: Minesweeper 2DS
Packages.Description: Minesweeper clone for the 3DS.

Packages.Name: EDuke3D
Packages.Description: EDuke32 (Duke Nukem 3D)  port for the 3DS.

Packages.Name: ctrQuake
Packages.Description: Quake port for the 3DS with support for online multiplayer. Only includes the shareware episode, unlock full game by placing pak1.pak from the full game into the id1 folder.

Packages.Name: Zelda: Return of the Hylian (CIA)
Packages.Description: Zelda fan-game in the style of A Link to the Past, ported to the 3DS. Features a full quest line with hours of gameplay. CIA release.

Packages.Name: Zelda: Return of the Hylian (3DSX)
Packages.Description: Zelda fan-game in the style of A Link to the Past, ported to the 3DS. Features a full quest line with hours of gameplay. 3DSX release.

Packages.Name: blargSNES
Packages.Description: SNES emulator for the 3DS.

Packages.Name: snes9x
Packages.Description: SNES emulator for the 3DS.

Packages.Name: VirtuaNES
Packages.Description: NES emulator for the 3DS.

Packages.Name: mGBA
Packages.Description: GBA emulator for the 3DS.

Packages.Name: GameYob
Packages.Description: GB/GBC/GBA emulator for the 3DS.

Packages.Name: PicoDrive 3DS
Packages.Description: Master System/Mega Drive emulator for the 3DS.

FAQs.question: What do I do with the ZIP file downloaded?
FAQs.answer: Extract <b>the contents<b/> of the compressed folder named sd to the root of your SD card. The PC folder will contain the tools you selected. The readmes folder will contain useful readmes for using the PC tools. the licenses folder contains licenses requried to comply with redistribution requirements.

FAQs.question: Why can ZIPs take so long to generate?
FAQs.answer: This application uses the experimental Blazor project by the ASP.NET team. This software, while functional, has many performance issues. Other than C# code often running up to 100x slower than a native desktop app, native C# zip libraries run way too slow to be useful. As such, all files need to be downloaded individually and fed into a JavaScript zip library, which takes much longer than downloading compressed zip files. Additionally, at this moment in time, Blazor code can only run on one thread.

FAQs.question: A package on here is outdated!
FAQs.answer: I try my best to make sure packages are up to date as often as possible. Please let me know in a <a href="https://www.github.com/noahc3/sdsetup/issues/">GitHub issue<a/> if something is outdated.

FAQs.question: I want another package to be listed here! / I want to see another feature!
FAQs.answer: Make an issue on <a href="https://www.github.com/noahc3/sdsetup/issues/">GitHub<a/> clearly stating what changes you would like made.

FAQs.question: I am a developer of a package rehosted here and I would like it removed. / You are violating the redistribution rights of my softwares license.
FAQs.answer: I've tried my best to make sure I am complying with licenses correctly! If something is wrong or you would simply like your software removed, please let me know in a <a href="https://www.github.com/noahc3/sdsetup/issues">GitHub issue<a/> and I'll handle it ASAP!

FAQs.question: Why Blazor?
FAQs.answer: Most of my programming experience is in C# and Java, as such, I prefered to stick to what I know when making this (though I knew some JS interop would be necessary regardless). Plus I get to try out some cool new stuff!

FAQs.question: You know Blazor is experimental and isn't meant for production, right?
FAQs.answer: Since this app is entirely client-side (static), there is no security involved anywhere outside of basic HTTPS (99% of which is done in JS anyways), and compatibility is fine with Chrome and Firefox, I didn't see any reason not to use Blazor.
